DOC.brief_summary: This observational study among Latino patient coronary artery disease . The goal study determine association depressive symptom ability modify one 's health behavior . Specifically , participate physical activity .
DOC.brief_title: Determinants Cardiac Risk Factor Modification Latinos With Coronary Artery Disease
DOC.detailed_description: Specific aim : Among 213 Latino adult patient coronary artery angioplasty within past month , specific aim propose study : 1 . To determine whether patient depressive symptom time angioplasty less likely active physical activity two year . Physical activity measure survey ask patient describe activity include leisure activity housework . 2 . To determine whether low perceive social support , low self-efficacy engage physical activity , great perceive stress mediate effect depressive symptom participation physical activity . Long-term objective : The long-term objective study use data develop culturally tailor intervention increase participation physical activity ultimately improve overall health well Latino adult coronary artery disease . Outcome : The outcome action maintenance stage physical activity two year angioplasty The stage physical activity participation base Stages Change model . This model describe behavior change continuum pre-contemplation contemplation .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Patients must identify ethnicity Latino Hispanic Patients must able complete questionnaire either English Spanish . Patients must angiographic evidence coronary artery disease require angioplasty Patients must also clinically stable interview Patient must able provide inform consent . Exclusion criteria Patients clinically stable cardiac arrest , intubate , active psychosis , cognitively impaired . Patients unable provide consent .
